text: <@UN1497LJC> There's so few things to put in an algo that the way they're measured becomes worth looking at.   Take basic price moves or spike size :  is that #ticks, simple p2-p1, implied chance p2-p1,  change as a %age of p1 or as a %age of p2, change relative to the closest opposition, change as however many standard deviations from trend, price change acceleration/deceleration etc etc, the longer the liquid lunch the more you think of :slightly_smiling_face:  With big edges it probably doesn't matter much but scratching around in the sub 1% zone small things can make big differences.  Just imo, no claims of being a superstar...or even being right!

elements.text: There's so few things to put in an algo that the way they're measured becomes worth looking at. text:
Stepping back a bit from this haystack search... thinking why would value or the destination of BSP be determined by some tiny pattern of wom, price action, or whatever tech...? Just doesn't sound sensible, the crowd knows what it wants at time "now", but I can't see how it can predict in any form of technical indicator future BSP
All i know is what is value "now", ie. A price above/below "now", but I cant have that or at least not enough to cover spread & commission and some spare...
Hmmm,seems an impossible problem

text: <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> This perspective is an improvement. As others have noted you have to dive deep somewhere, but you can only do so while building your understanding of the market, such that you can justify why diving deep in a particular space is worthwhile. If you have no understanding you end up shallowly moving about, never going deep enough to find something

text: I`m not sure why you picked Aus racing because even if you produce the best strategy ever, I`m sure there are some limitations on the Back bets you can place.

text: <@U01PQ9SR9MJ> Aus is a lot easier than UK imo. Limitations only apply to NSW so I blanket exclude all those and there's still plenty left.  Aus markets are weaker but I like to focus on weaker stuff because that what 90% of Betfair markets are.

elements.text: Aus is a lot easier than UK imo. Limitations only apply to NSW so I blanket exclude all those and there's still plenty left.  Aus markets are weaker but I like to focus on weaker stuff because that what 90% of Betfair markets are.

text: <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> Strip it back to basics, if you were a punter backing blind would you be a winner, and if you weren't a winner who'd would be taking your money? And with your strategy, if it's not a winner then who's got your cash?

elements.text: Strip it back to basics, if you were a punter backing blind would you be a winner, and if you weren't a winner who'd would be taking your money? And with your strategy, if it's not a winner then who's got your cash?

text: <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> Try not to expect too much.  9 months ago you hadn't even used Betfair,  and 3 months ago you were still using 1s data and Guardian. Now you're trying to keep up with seasoned pros who live and breathe this stuff so it's only to be expected that you'll hit a few brick walls.

elements.text: Try not to expect too much.  9 months ago you hadn't even used Betfair,  and 3 months ago you were still using 1s data and Guardian. Now you're trying to keep up with seasoned pros who live and breathe this stuff so it's only to be expected that you'll hit a few brick walls.
